description: From Hindi कूज़ा (kūzā), from Persian کوزه‎ (kuza).

entries.meaning: (India) A wide-mouthed earthenware vessel for water.
examples: Let us take a peep into the bechoba. All hushed and quiet. A piece of camp able close to the tent wall, and on it a tumbler of cocoanut [sic] oil, with a lighted wick floating on the surface. Here, also, a watch, a cheroot case, and cooja of drinking-water standing on a broken soup-plate.
